intro: Sinningia schomburgkiana, commonly known as the Schomburgkian gloxinia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and features tuberous roots that store nutrients. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Sinningia schomburgkiana is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation indoors.
